verses.verse: Then spake<WH559> Solomon<WH8010>, Jehovah<WH3068> hath said<WH559> that he would dwell<WH7931> in the thick darkness<WH6205>.
But I have built<WH1129> thee a house<WH1004> of habitation<WH2073>, and a place<WH4349> for thee to dwell<WH3427> in for ever<WH5769>.
And the king<WH4428> turned<WH5437> his face<WH6440>, and blessed<WH1288> all the assembly<WH6951> of Israel<WH3478>: and all the assembly<WH6951> of Israel<WH3478> stood<WH5975>.

And he said<WH559>, Blessed<WH1288> be Jehovah<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, who spake<WH1696> with his mouth<WH6310> unto David<WH1732> my father<WH1>, and hath with his hands<WH3027> fulfilled<WH4390> it<WH559>, saying,

Since the day<WH3117> that I brought forth<WH3318> my people<WH5971> out of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, I chose<WH977> no city<WH5892> out of all the tribes<WH7626> of Israel<WH3478> to build<WH1129> a house<WH1004> in<WH8034>, that my name might be there<WH977>; neither chose I any man<WH376> to be prince<WH5057> over my people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478>:
but I have chosen<WH977> Jerusalem<WH3389>, that my name<WH8034> might be there<WH977>; and have chosen David<WH1732> to be over my people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478>.
Now it was in the heart<WH3824> of David<WH1732> my father<WH1> to build<WH1129> a house<WH1004> for the name<WH8034> of Jehovah<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>.

But Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH559> unto David<WH1732> my father<WH1>, Whereas it was in thy heart<WH3824> to build<WH1129> a house<WH1004> for my name<WH8034>, thou didst well<WH2895> that it was in thy heart<WH3824>:

nevertheless <WH7535> thou shalt not build<WH1129> the house<WH1004>; but thy son<WH1121> that shall come forth<WH3318> out of thy loins<WH2504>, he shall build<WH1129> the house<WH1004> for my name<WH8034>.

And Jehovah<WH3068> hath performed<WH6965> his word<WH1697> that he spake<WH1696>; for I am risen up<WH6965> in the room of David<WH1732> my father<WH1>, and sit<WH3427> on the throne<WH3678> of Israel<WH3478>, as Jehovah<WH3068> promised<WH1696>, and have built<WH1129> the house<WH1004> for the name<WH8034> of Jehovah<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>.
And there<WH8033> have I set<WH7760> the ark<WH727>, wherein is the covenant<WH1285> of Jehovah<WH3068>, which he made<WH3772> with the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>.
And he stood<WH5975> before<WH6440> the altar<WH4196> of Jehovah<WH3068> in the presence of all the assembly<WH6951> of Israel<WH3478>, and spread forth<WH6566> his hands<WH3709>;

(for Solomon<WH8010> had made<WH6213> a brazen<WH5178> scaffold<WH3595>, five<WH2568> cubits<WH520> long<WH753>, and five<WH2568> cubits<WH520> broad<WH7341>, and three<WH7969> cubits<WH520> high<WH6967>, and had set<WH5414> it in the midst<WH8432> of the court<WH5835>; and upon it he stood<WH5975>, and kneeled down<WH1288> upon his knees<WH1290> before all the assembly<WH6951> of Israel<WH3478>, and spread forth<WH6566> his hands<WH3709> toward heaven<WH8064>;)

and he said<WH559>, O Jehovah<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, there is no God<WH430> like thee<WH8064>, in heaven, or on earth<WH776>; who keepest<WH8104> covenant<WH1285> and lovingkindness<WH2617> with thy servants<WH5650>, that walk<WH1980> before<WH6440> thee with all their heart<WH3820>;

who hast kept<WH8104> with thy servant<WH5650> David<WH1732> my father<WH1> that which thou didst promise<WH1696> him<WH1696>: yea, thou spakest with thy mouth<WH6310>, and hast fulfilled<WH4390> it with thy hand<WH3027>, as it is this day<WH3117>.

Now therefore<WH3068>, O Jehovah, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, keep<WH8104> with thy servant<WH5650> David<WH1732> my father<WH1> that which thou hast promised<WH1696> him<WH559>, saying, There shall not fail<WH3772> thee a man<WH376> in my sight<WH6440> to sit<WH3427> on the throne<WH3678> of Israel<WH3478>, if only<WH7535> thy children<WH1121> take heed<WH8104> to their way<WH1870>, to walk<WH3212> in my law<WH8451> as thou hast walked<WH1980> before me<WH6440>.
Now therefore<WH3068>, O Jehovah, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, let thy word<WH1697> be verified<WH539>, which thou spakest<WH1696> unto thy servant<WH5650> David<WH1732>.

But will God<WH430> in very deed<WH552> dwell<WH3427> with men<WH120> on the earth<WH776>? behold<WH8064>, heaven and the heaven<WH8064> of heavens<WH8064> cannot contain<WH3557> thee<WH1004>; how much less this house which I have builded<WH1129>!

Yet have thou respect<WH6437> unto the prayer<WH8605> of thy servant<WH5650>, and to his supplication<WH8467>, O Jehovah<WH3068> my God<WH430>, to hearken<WH8085> unto the cry<WH7440> and to the prayer<WH8605> which thy servant<WH5650> prayeth<WH6419> before thee<WH6440>;

that thine eyes<WH5869> may be open<WH6605> toward this house<WH1004> day<WH3119> and night<WH3915>, even toward the place<WH4725> whereof thou hast said<WH559> that thou wouldest put<WH7760> thy name<WH8034> there<WH8085>; to hearken unto the prayer<WH8605> which thy servant<WH5650> shall pray<WH6419> toward this place<WH4725>.

And hearken<WH8085> thou to the supplications<WH8469> of thy servant<WH5650>, and of thy people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478>, when they shall pray<WH6419> toward this place<WH4725>: yea<WH8085>, hear thou from thy dwelling<WH3427> - place<WH4725>, even from heaven<WH8064>; and when thou hearest<WH8085> forgive<WH5545>.

If a man<WH376> sin<WH2398> against his neighbor<WH7453>, and an oath<WH423> be laid<WH5375> upon him to cause him to swear<WH422>, and he come<WH935> and swear<WH422> before<WH6440> thine altar<WH4196> in this house<WH1004>;

then hear<WH8085> thou from heaven<WH8064>, and do<WH6213>, and judge<WH8199> thy servants<WH5650>, requiting<WH7725> the wicked<WH7563>, to bring<WH5414> his way<WH1870> upon his own head<WH7218>; and justifying<WH6663> the righteous<WH6662>, to give<WH5414> him according to his righteousness<WH6666>.

And if thy people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478> be smitten<WH5062> down before<WH6440> the enemy<WH341>, because they have sinned<WH2398> against thee<WH7725>, and shall turn again and confess<WH3034> thy name<WH8034>, and pray<WH6419> and make supplication<WH2603> before<WH6440> thee in this house<WH1004>;

then hear<WH8085> thou from heaven<WH8064>, and forgive<WH5545> the sin<WH2403> of thy people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478>, and bring them again<WH7725> unto the land<WH127> which thou gavest<WH5414> to them and to their fathers<WH1>.

When the heavens<WH8064> are shut up<WH6113>, and there is no rain<WH4306>, because they have sinned<WH2398> against thee<WH6419>; if they pray toward this place<WH4725>, and confess<WH3034> thy name<WH8034>, and turn<WH7725> from their sin<WH2403>, when thou dost afflict them<WH6031>:

then hear<WH8085> thou in heaven<WH8064>, and forgive<WH5545> the sin<WH2403> of thy servants<WH5650>, and of thy people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478>, when thou teachest<WH3384> them the good<WH2896> way<WH1870> wherein they should walk<WH3212>; and send<WH5414> rain<WH4306> upon thy land<WH776>, which thou hast given<WH5414> to thy people<WH5971> for an inheritance<WH5159>.

If there be in the land<WH776> famine<WH7458>, if there be pestilence<WH1698>, if there be blasting<WH7711> or mildew<WH3420>, locust<WH697> or caterpillar<WH2625>; if their enemies<WH341> besiege<WH6887> them in the land<WH776> of their cities<WH8179>; whatsoever plague<WH5061> or whatsoever sickness there be<WH4245>;

what prayer<WH8605> and supplication<WH8467> soever be made by any man<WH120>, or by all thy people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478>, who shall know<WH3045> every man<WH376> his own plague<WH5061> and his own sorrow<WH4341>, and shall spread forth<WH6566> his hands<WH3709> toward this house<WH1004>:

then hear<WH8085> thou from heaven<WH8064> thy dwelling<WH3427> - place<WH4349> and forgive<WH5545>, and render<WH5414> unto every man<WH376> according to all his ways<WH1870>, whose heart<WH3824> thou knowest<WH3045>; (for thou<WH3045>, even thou only, knowest the hearts<WH3824> of the children<WH1121> of men<WH120>;)
that they may fear<WH3372> thee<WH3212>, to walk in thy ways<WH1870>, so long as<WH3117> they live<WH2416> in the land<WH127> which thou gavest<WH5414> unto our fathers<WH1>.

Moreover concerning the foreigner<WH5237>, that is not of thy people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478>, when he shall come<WH935> from a far<WH7350> country<WH776> for thy great<WH1419> name<WH8034>'s sake<WH2389>, and thy mighty hand<WH3027>, and thine outstretched<WH5186> arm<WH2220>; when they shall come<WH935> and pray<WH6419> toward this house<WH1004>:

then hear<WH8085> thou from heaven<WH8064>, even from thy dwelling<WH3427> - place<WH4349>, and do<WH6213> according to all that the foreigner<WH5237> calleth<WH7121> to thee for<WH5971>; that all the peoples of the earth<WH776> may know<WH3045> thy name<WH8034>, and fear<WH3372> thee<WH5971>, as doth thy people Israel<WH3478>, and that they may know<WH3045> that this house<WH1004> which I have built<WH1129> is called<WH7121> by thy name<WH8034>.

If thy people<WH5971> go out<WH3318> to battle<WH4421> against their enemies<WH341>, by whatsoever way<WH1870> thou shalt send<WH7971> them<WH6419>, and they pray unto thee toward<WH1870> this city<WH5892> which thou hast chosen<WH977>, and the house<WH1004> which I have built<WH1129> for thy name<WH8034>;
then hear<WH8085> thou from heaven<WH8064> their prayer<WH8605> and their supplication<WH8467>, and maintain<WH6213> their cause<WH4941>.

If they sin<WH2398> against thee<WH120> (for there is no man that sinneth<WH2398> not<WH599>), and thou be angry with them<WH5414>, and deliver them to<WH6440> the enemy<WH341>, so that they carry them away<WH7617> captive<WH7617> unto a land<WH776> far off<WH7350> or near<WH7138>;

yet if they shall bethink<WH7725> themselves in the land<WH776> whither they are carried captive<WH7617>, and turn<WH7725> again<WH2603>, and make supplication unto thee in the land<WH776> of their captivity<WH7628>, saying<WH559>, We have sinned<WH2398>, we have done perversely<WH7561>, and have dealt wickedly<WH7561>;

if they return<WH7725> unto thee with all their heart<WH3820> and with all their soul<WH5315> in the land<WH776> of their captivity<WH7628>, whither they have carried them captive<WH7617>, and pray<WH6419> toward<WH1870> their land<WH776>, which thou gavest<WH5414> unto their fathers<WH1>, and the city<WH5892> which thou hast chosen<WH977>, and toward the house<WH1004> which I have built<WH1129> for thy name<WH8034>:

then hear<WH8085> thou from heaven<WH8064>, even from thy dwelling<WH3427> - place<WH4349>, their prayer<WH8605> and their supplications<WH8467>, and maintain<WH6213> their cause<WH4941>, and forgive<WH5545> thy people<WH5971> who have sinned against thee<WH2398>.
Now <WH430>, O my God, let<WH5869>, I beseech thee, thine eyes be open<WH6605>, and let thine ears<WH241> be attent<WH7183>, unto the prayer<WH8605> that is made in this place<WH4725>.

Now therefore arise<WH6965>, O Jehovah<WH3068> God<WH430>, into thy resting-place<WH5118>, thou<WH727>, and the ark of thy strength<WH5797>: let thy priests<WH3548>, O Jehovah<WH3068> God<WH430>, be clothed<WH3847> with salvation<WH8668>, and let thy saints<WH2623> rejoice<WH8055> in goodness<WH2896>.
O Jehovah<WH3068> God<WH430>, turn not away<WH7725> the face<WH6440> of thine anointed<WH4899>: remember<WH2142> thy lovingkindnesses<WH2617> to David<WH1732> thy servant<WH5650>.
